page.title: 05Industries at Todmorden Moor
page.content: Very few industries remain in the area. There has in the past been some {stone quarrying}and{coal mining}but this has declined and only exists in a very limited way now. There has also been in the past a{pipe works}on the Bacup Road side of the moor utilising local clay but this has now closed and all that is left is a largely derelict site occupied in part by a{maggot {farm.}On the Burnley Road side of the moor there are several old woollen and cotton mills which have long since closed and come back into limited use as small units for local firms. The major remaining industries are{ {Turn Leathers,} Leather Clothes: {N&R Contractors,} Demolition: {Norman Jowett,} Haulage & Storage: {James H Sutcliffe,}Home Furniture: {Alan Cooper,} Office Furniture and various smaller, local businesses.
